examples.text: Huge chimneys belched forth smoke and grime.
Water gushed forth from a hole in the rock.

definitions.definition: used at the end of a list to show that it continues in the same way

examples.text: We discussed everything—when to go, what to see and so on.

definitions.definition: from one place to another and back again repeatedly

examples.text: ferries sailing back and forth between the islands

definitions.definition: beginning on that day; from that time

examples.text: From that day forth she gave me endless friendship and encouragement.

wordOrigin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch voort and German fort, from an Indo-European root shared by fore-.
